poem:
Crossword Morning  
  
In the quiet  
of dawn—  
  
clues scattered  
like seeds on  
newsprint soil.  
  
I watch them grow  
on the page,  
each word a sprout,  
a whispered riddle,  
  
boxes filled with  
thoughts taking root,  
letter by letter—  
  
the world unfolds  
in black and white,  
a garden of  
words awakening.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Quiptic crossword No 1,349". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
